body:
Hello, any news about this?

thanks

I can confirm that this is still a problem for version 0.14.50 running OpenBSD-6.4-beta.

Test log attached.

[test.log](https://github.com/syncthing/syncthing/files/2441375/test.log)

issue.title: Syncthing recreates the directories for deleted/missing "Folders"

labels.name: bug
labels.description: A problem with current functionality, as opposed to missing functionality (enhancement)

labels.name: frozen-due-to-age
labels.description: Issues closed and untouched for a long time, together with being locked for discussion

issue.body:
As the title says, Syncthing recreates or tries to recreate the directories for deleted or missing Folders. I have two examples below. They are similar in the sense that the Folder path and folder marker are gone when the issue happens.

## Example 1
### What happened
- I had a Folder added to Syncthing residing at path `/Volumes/foo/bar/baz` which is on an external hard drive. Just to clarify, the folder marker is `/Volumes/foo/bar/baz/.stfolder`.
- I decided to move it to somewhere else but also decided to deal with updating the path of the Folder later.
- I paused the Folder in Syncthing UI.
- I moved the folder to its new location. `foo` directory doesn't exist in `/Volumes` anymore.
- [issue] When I restart Syncthing it creates the `/Volumes/foo/bar/baz` directory structure while the Folder is still paused.
- [expected] If I resume the Folder I get `folder marker missing` error

### What I expected to happen
- Syncthing should not create `foo/bar/baz` directories in `/Volumes`.

### Steps to reproduce
- Create a few directories inside each other on an external drive (I am not sure if the drive being external is necessary, that is just how my setup is)
- Add the deepest directory to Syncthing as a Folder
- Pause the Folder
- Delete the whole directory structure up to the root of the external drive
- Restart Syncthing
- Observe. Sometimes Finder doesn't update itself so closing/reopening the Finder window might be necessary.

### Screen recording (8.1 MB)
![folder recreation bug](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/732128/39232569-9305e974-4822-11e8-8f28-825bae7b7874.gif)

## Example 2
### What happened
- I have an encrypted directory that I mount to /Volumes/EncFS, which is also added to Syncthing. Just to clarify, the folder marker is `/Volumes/EncFS/.stfolder`.
- When I restart my computer, that encrypted directory is not mounted automatically.
- [issue] Syncthing start automatically and gives me `Creating directory for foobar: mkdir /Volumes/EncFS: permission denied ` error. (`foobar` is a directory that is in `/Volumes/EncFS` when the encrypted directory is mounted.)
- [expected] I also get `folder marker missing` error

### What I expected to happen
- Syncthing should not try to create `EncFS` or `EncFS/foobar` directories in `/Volumes`.

### Steps to reproduce
- Create an encrypted directory
- Mount the encrypted directory
- Add some files/directories in the mount point
- Add the mount point to Syncthing as a Folder
- Share that Folder with other Syncthing instances and make sure they are synched
- Restart computer.
- Open Syncthing UI and observe the errors.

#### Version Information
Syncthing Version: v0.14.46, macOS (64 bit)
OS Version: macOS High Sierra 10.13.4 (17E202)

body: @imsodin how would one debug this? I guess logging won't log much about this?
Running with `fs` and `watchaggregator` (`STTRACE=fs,watchaggregator`) set may provide some hints. And if it is still flaky (?) also provide those logs from a successful test run.

Here's a log with that environment set.

[test.log.gz](https://github.com/syncthing/syncthing/files/2445636/test.log.gz)

Let me know if there's anything else I can provide.

Uff, the log is convoluted, it's not clear which lines belong to which test :(

```
2018/10/04 09:57:24.465273 folder_sendrecv.go:1749: INFO: Puller (folder "default" (default), file "symlink/testdir"): traverses q: traverses symlink: symlink
2018/10/04 09:57:24.465296 folder_sendrecv.go:1749: INFO: Puller (folder "default" (default), file "symlink/testsyml"): traverses q: traverses symlink: symlink
2018/10/04 09:57:24.465321 folder_sendrecv.go:1749: INFO: Puller (folder "default" (default), file "symlink/testfile"): traverses q: traverses symlink: symlink
``` 

But I don't think this could be it?

There is not just `TestWatchIgnore` failing (which I believe did not log anything, my proposition was BS, sorry), but also `TestInternalScan`, `TestIssue4903` and `TestParentDeletion`. All of the latter are more important than the watch error. So I'd suggest navigation to `./lib/model` and running `STTRACE=model go test -race -v -run TestInternalScan` (same for other to tests) to see what's going on there. And maybe move this over to the forum (?).

OK, I have all the test outputs via the method outlined by @imsodin above.

If it's OK, I'd rather post the issues one per issue on github.

issue.title: TestWatchIgnore test failure on OpenBSD

labels.name: frozen-due-to-age
labels.description: Issues closed and untouched for a long time, together with being locked for discussion

issue.body:
As discussed in #5077, the `TestWatchIgnore` test is failing on OpenBSD.

```
fremen% STTRACE=fs go test -v -run TestWatchIgnore
=== RUN   TestWatchIgnore
2018/10/05 14:33:26.878085 logfs.go:73: DEBUG: basicfs_watch_test.go:363 basic /home/porter/go/src/github.com/syncthing/syncthing/lib/fs/testdata MkdirAll ignore 493 <nil>
2018/10/05 14:33:26.878817 logfs.go:133: DEBUG: basicfs_watch_test.go:371 basic /home/porter/go/src/github.com/syncthing/syncthing/lib/fs/testdata Watch ignore {ignore/ignored  true} false <nil>
2018/10/05 14:33:26.878887 logfs.go:73: DEBUG: basicfs_watch_test.go:339 basic /home/porter/go/src/github.com/syncthing/syncthing/lib/fs/testdata MkdirAll ignore 493 <nil>
2018/10/05 14:33:26.879139 logfs.go:43: DEBUG: basicfs_watch_test.go:342 basic /home/porter/go/src/github.com/syncthing/syncthing/lib/fs/testdata Create ignore/file {0xc00000c068 ignore/file} <nil>
2018/10/05 14:33:26.879189 logfs.go:73: DEBUG: basicfs_watch_test.go:339 basic /home/porter/go/src/github.com/syncthing/syncthing/lib/fs/testdata MkdirAll ignore 493 <nil>
2018/10/05 14:33:26.879387 logfs.go:43: DEBUG: basicfs_watch_test.go:342 basic /home/porter/go/src/github.com/syncthing/syncthing/lib/fs/testdata Create ignore/ignored {0xc00000c070 ignore/ignored} <nil>
2018/10/05 14:34:26.886073 logfs.go:103: DEBUG: basicfs_watch_test.go:386 basic /home/porter/go/src/github.com/syncthing/syncthing/lib/fs/testdata RemoveAll ignore remove /home/porter/go/src/github.com/syncthing/syncthing/lib/fs/testdata/ignore: directory not empty                                                    
--- FAIL: TestWatchIgnore (60.01s)
    basicfs_watch_test.go:382: Timed out before receiving all expected events
FAIL
exit status 1
FAIL    github.com/syncthing/syncthing/lib/fs   60.021s
```

OpenBSD-6.4-beta/Syncthing master.

Cheers

body: I've raised the first of the failures in #5243.

Sorry for the duplication (my bad).

Here's the info about this failure:
```
fremen% STTRACE=fs go test -v -run TestWatchIgnore
=== RUN   TestWatchIgnore
2018/10/05 14:33:26.878085 logfs.go:73: DEBUG: basicfs_watch_test.go:363 basic /home/porter/go/src/github.com/syncthing/syncthing/lib/fs/testdata MkdirAll ignore 493 <nil>
2018/10/05 14:33:26.878817 logfs.go:133: DEBUG: basicfs_watch_test.go:371 basic /home/porter/go/src/github.com/syncthing/syncthing/lib/fs/testdata Watch ignore {ignore/ignored  true} false <nil>
2018/10/05 14:33:26.878887 logfs.go:73: DEBUG: basicfs_watch_test.go:339 basic /home/porter/go/src/github.com/syncthing/syncthing/lib/fs/testdata MkdirAll ignore 493 <nil>
2018/10/05 14:33:26.879139 logfs.go:43: DEBUG: basicfs_watch_test.go:342 basic /home/porter/go/src/github.com/syncthing/syncthing/lib/fs/testdata Create ignore/file {0xc00000c068 ignore/file} <nil>
2018/10/05 14:33:26.879189 logfs.go:73: DEBUG: basicfs_watch_test.go:339 basic /home/porter/go/src/github.com/syncthing/syncthing/lib/fs/testdata MkdirAll ignore 493 <nil>
2018/10/05 14:33:26.879387 logfs.go:43: DEBUG: basicfs_watch_test.go:342 basic /home/porter/go/src/github.com/syncthing/syncthing/lib/fs/testdata Create ignore/ignored {0xc00000c070 ignore/ignored} <nil>
2018/10/05 14:34:26.886073 logfs.go:103: DEBUG: basicfs_watch_test.go:386 basic /home/porter/go/src/github.com/syncthing/syncthing/lib/fs/testdata RemoveAll ignore remove /home/porter/go/src/github.com/syncthing/syncthing/lib/fs/testdata/ignore: directory not empty                                                    
--- FAIL: TestWatchIgnore (60.01s)
    basicfs_watch_test.go:382: Timed out before receiving all expected events
FAIL
exit status 1
FAIL    github.com/syncthing/syncthing/lib/fs   60.021s
```

This was using the git version:`f528923d1ef224a07d58fea21b0dca14ca18ba78`
This still fails on the VM I was given, but I assume because of inotify simply not working on openbsd.
Ref https://github.com/rjeczalik/notify/issues/172
Can we just disable the inotify tests on OpenBSD and get on with our lives?
Generally disable watcher on openbss i assume?
Probably, as it's weird as explained in the issue.

Sounds like the watcher works (going by the talk in the other issue), just that recursive watches take some time to take effect. This shouldn't really affect Syncthing other than by the test failure, as we'll do a recursive scan of the path we get a notification for and see any additions below it as well. And they get watched too, just with a short delay?

Looking at Audrius's experimentation on the notify issue, it looks like the delay incurred is a matter of seconds. Could the test be fixed by simply waiting longer on OpenBSD?

> Generally disable watcher on openbsd i assume?

What are the consequences of disabling the watcher?

> Could the test be fixed by simply waiting longer on OpenBSD?

No, because this waiting needs to happen in ths inotify library and not our tests.

Also, I always have a sudden urge to throw up while adding sleeps to fix the tests.

I think we disable the tests, declare inotify support on openbsd "best effort but might be broken" and move on.

Does syncthing operate fine without inotify?

Cheers

wrote:

> You are receiving this because you commented.
> Reply to this email directly, view it on GitHub

It should. There are periodic rescans to fill the gap, and also us knowing that some directory was created would force syncthing to traverse the whole tree down anyway.

In that case, I think your proposal sounds good. But perhaps add a comment
saying why we skip the test?

Once again, thanks for looking into this. I'm most grateful.
